results.adx_keywords: Food;Diet and Nutrition;Research;Brain;Mental Health and Disorders;Content Type: Service
results.title: The Link Between Highly Processed Foods and Brain Health
results.abstract: Eating packaged foods like cereal and frozen meals has been associated with anxiety, depression and cognitive decline. Scientists are still piecing together why.

results.adx_keywords: Law and Legislation;Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;State Legislatures;Voting and Voters;States (US);Trump, Donald J;Mitchell, Cleta;Republican Party
results.byline: By Nick Corasaniti and Alexandra Berzon
results.title: Under the Radar, Right-Wing Push to Tighten Voting Laws Persists
results.abstract: The clashes in state capitals have faded, but the Republican push for stricter state election laws is organized and planning for the long term.

media.caption: A network of billionaire-backed advocacy groups has formed a new hub of election advocacy within the Republican Party.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show;Dogs;Pets
results.title: Striker Will Never Know He Wasn’t Best in Show
results.abstract: A blindingly white Samoyed fell just short of the top spot at Westminster in consecutive years, but the now-retired champion is busy playing, romping, posing and shedding.

media.caption: Striker is still cared for by the team that managed his dog show career, including Marc Ralsky and the breeder Judi Elford.
media.copyright: May Truong for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Khan, Imran;Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf;Pakistan
results.byline: By Christina Goldbaum and Salman Masood
results.title: Imran Khan, Pakistan’s Ex-Leader, Is Arrested
results.abstract: Mr. Khan, a former cricket star, has staged a comeback since being ousted, openly challenging the powerful military. His detention raises fears of mass protests.

results.byline: By Benjamin Weiser, Lola Fadulu and Kate Christobek
results.title: Donald Trump Sexually Abused and Defamed E. Jean Carroll, Jury Finds
results.abstract: The ex-president must pay Ms. Carroll $5 million. More than a dozen women have accused Mr. Trump of sexual misconduct, but this civil case was the only one tested before a jury.

results.title: When Should Women Get Regular Mammograms? At 40, U.S. Panel Now Says.
results.abstract: The new advice comes as breast cancer diagnoses rise among younger women and mortality rates among Black women remain persistently high.
org_facet: United States Preventive Services Task Force

media.caption: The new recommendation covers more than 20 million women in the United States between the ages of 40 and 49.

results.adx_keywords: Pulitzer Prizes;News and News Media;Newspapers;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Archibald, John (1963- );Alabama Media Group;Alabama;Brookside (Ala)
results.title: Father-Son Duo in Alabama Wins Pulitzer, Bucking Headwinds in Local News
results.abstract: John Archibald, who has been a journalist in Birmingham, Ala., for years, was anxious about his son Ramsey’s decision to go into journalism. He needn’t have worried.

media.caption: Ramsey Archibald celebrating with his father, John Archibald, who won the 2018 Pulitzer Prize for commentary in Birmingham, Ala.

results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Age, Chronological;State Legislatures;Allen, Tex, Mall Shooting (May 2023);Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Mass Shootings;Republican Party;Texas
results.title: In Shift, Texas House Advances Bill to Raise Age to Buy Assault Weapons
results.abstract: The mass shooting at a shopping center in Allen, Texas, has exerted an unexpectedly raw and emotional force on the State Legislature.

media.caption: Veronica Mata, right, and Gloria Cazares, whose daughters were killed in the Uvalde school shooting last year, embraced after a Texas House committee voted on Monday to advance a bill raising the minimum age for some gun purchases.
media.copyright: Tamir Kalifa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Children and Childhood;Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Banks, David C (1962- );Education Department (NYC);New York City
results.title: New York Is Forcing Schools to Change How They Teach Children to Read
results.abstract: Half of children in grades three to eight fail reading tests. The city’s schools chancellor, who has faulted the current approach, will begin rolling out new curriculums next year.

media.caption: Over the last two decades, thousands of New York City children have struggled to pick up reading skills. Now, schools will be forced to change how they teach reading.
media.copyright: Thalia Juarez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Health Insurance and Managed Care;Doctors;Medicare;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Flach, Ken;Amazon.com Inc;CVS Caremark Corporation;UnitedHealth Group Inc;One Medical (1Life Healthcare Inc);Oak Street Health;Neighborhood Health Center (Portland, Ore)
results.title: Corporate Giants Buy Up Primary Care Practices at Rapid Pace
results.abstract: Large health insurers and other companies are especially keen on doctors’ groups that care for patients in private Medicare plans.

media.caption: Nurse practitioner Haley Lynn, left, with patient Nathaniel Brookard, at Oak Street Health in Brooklyn. CVS Health recently bought Oak Street’s fast-growing chain of primary care centers that employ doctors in 21 states.

results.adx_keywords: Horses;Donkeys;Veterinary Medicine;Volunteers and Community Service;Rural Areas;Castration;your-feed-science;vis-photo;your-feed-animals;Guanajuato (Mexico)
results.byline: By Emiliano Rodríguez Mega and Victor J. Blue
results.title: Meet the Roving Veterinarians Caring for Mexico’s Rural Horses
results.abstract: Horses, donkeys and mules can be a lifeline for families living in the countryside, but there haven’t always been vets around to treat them.

media.caption: A veterinary student waits for a donkey to wake up from anesthesia at a clinic in rural Mexico.

results.adx_keywords: Dementia;Alzheimer's Disease;Elderly;Memory;internal-sub-only
results.title: The Mother Who Changed: A Story of Dementia
results.abstract: As cognitive decline began to alter who Diane Norelius was, her adult daughters and her boyfriend wound up in a bitter dispute over which version of her should get to decide what she wanted.

results.adx_keywords: Opera;Pulitzer Prizes;Abels, Michael (Composer);Giddens, Rhiannon
results.title: Rhiannon Giddens and Michael Abels Win the Pulitzer Prize for Music
results.abstract: Giddens said that the success of their opera “Omar” proves that “nobody has the lock on being a composer.”

media.caption: Jamez McCorkle in the title role of the opera “Omar,” by Rhiannon Giddens and Michael Abels, at Spoleto Festival USA last year.

results.title: Webb Telescope Finds a Star Cloaked in 3 Rings of Ruined Worlds
results.abstract: Astronomers have gained a new understanding of the chaos that wreathes the bright star Fomalhaut with the help of the powerful space observatory.

results.byline: By Michael Gold, William K. Rashbaum and Grace Ashford
results.title: George Santos Is Said to Face Federal Criminal Charges
results.abstract: The first-term Republican congressman’s extensive lies on the campaign trail and questionable financial dealings were the focus of criminal and ethical inquiries.

media.caption: Representative George Santos has been charged by federal prosecutors.

results.adx_keywords: Automobiles;Electric and Hybrid Vehicles;Automobile Service and Charging Stations;Oil (Petroleum) and Gasoline;Politics and Government;Batteries;Global Warming;Electric Light and Power;Greenhouse Gas Emissions;Labor and Jobs;Air Pollution;International Trade and World Market;Tesla Motors Inc;Volkswagen AG;Volvo Car Corp;Norway
results.title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
results.abstract: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.

media.caption: About 80 percent of new-car sales in Norway were electric last year, putting the country at the vanguard of the shift to emissions-free vehicles.
media.copyright: David B. Torch for The New York Times

results.title: A Gun-Filled America Is a World of Fear and Alienation
results.abstract: It is not a world of trust or hope or solidarity or any of the values we need to make democracy work as a way of life.

results.adx_keywords: Textbooks;Education (K-12);Book Trade and Publishing;Censorship;DeSantis, Ron;Education Department (Fla);Houghton Mifflin Harcourt;Florida
results.byline: By Sarah Mervosh and Dana Goldstein
results.title: Florida Rejects Dozens of Social Studies Textbooks, and Forces Changes in Others
results.abstract: The state objected to content on topics like the Black Lives Matter movement, socialism and why some citizens ‘take a knee’ during the national anthem.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida has campaigned against what he has described as “woke indoctrination” in the classroom.
